author.value: Collection processed by Emma Chiu and Brad Bauer

publisher.value: New York University Abu Dhabi Library

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-11-26T09:53:10</date>

corpname.value: New York University Abu Dhabi Library

unittitle.value: Andrew Eisenberg collection of East African commercial sound recordings

abstract.value: The Andrew Eisenberg collection of East African commercial sound recordings contains sound files and associated metadata for hundreds of commercial sound recordings produced for East African audiences, and in particular, African and Arab audiences of the Swahili Coast, between the late 1920s and the first decade of the twenty-first century.

p.value: If remote use of the collection is approved, a separate password will be supplied to provide access.

Much of Andrew Eisenberg's published and forthcoming scholarship focuses on issues of voice, place, and identity on Kenya's "Swahili coast." In recent years, he has also been carrying out ethnographic research on the music recording industry in the Kenyan capital Nairobi.
Series 3:  Digital audio transferred from commercially produced audiocassette recordings acquired by Eisenberg in Mombasa between 2004 and 2006.
